Title: the bakersfield expedition

Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is steaming a Star Trek uniform.
Vasquez Rocks. Sheldon, dressed as Data, is having his makeup put on by Raj, dressed as Worf.
Leonard: Hey, will you steam my uniform next?
Oh, thanks, I thought I had more.
Hey, hey, hey, hey. This is my Comic-Con makeup. I love you, but there are some things a man doesn’t share with his girlfriend.
That was San Diego Comic-Con. This is Bakersfield Comic-Con.
Well, it’s a lot smaller. It’s more about the comic books. The way these conventions used to be before they went all Hollywood.
Yeah.
Oh, hang on a second. (Hands her the day’s newspaper) Hold this. (Photographs the two of them together)
To show people when they don’t believe me.
It is on.
I’m turning it on, but just to shut you up.
What did you do?
Counterpoint, no, it’s not.
Really?
Yeah, that sounds fun.
No.
I’ll set the timer.
What? Hey, hey! Come back here!
I don’t believe this.
Mine, too. Anybody got any ideas?
What kind of a person steals another person’s car in broad daylight?
I thought we agreed this was all Koothrappali’s fault.
Look at us, Sheldon. We’re the crazy people.
Come on, let’s just start walking. There’s got to be a gas station or something nearby.
Yes.
Oh, you poor thing, you’re sweating. That’s so much worse than having your car stolen.
Please, Sheldon, I am so not in the mood.
Can I use your phone? Our car got stolen.
Our clothes, our wallets, phones.
Uh, we’re going to the Comic-Con in Bakersfield. They have a big costume contest. It’s cooler than it sounds.
Okay, he gets how cool it is.
Thanks, but we’ve got it covered.
Are you kidding me? After all we’ve been through, I just want to go home.
No, that can’t be right.
I say we investigate.
Fine, but set them to stun. If we vaporize Penny, I’ll never find a girlfriend that pretty again.
Sheldon: Interesting. Do you recall this conversation? Leonard, want to go halfsies on a steamer? No, Sheldon, we don’t need a steamer. Looks like that rumpled chicken’s come home to roost.
That’s a wise policy. I once borrowed my sister’s makeup for a costume contest. Got a terrible case of pinkeye. But luckily, I was going as a zombie. I won second place.
So to answer your question, no, it’s not better.
It’s a comic book convention. You know, it’s like pizza or particle accelerators, even the stinky one’s still pretty good.
I think you should turn on the GPS.
But the turn-by-turn voice option isn’t on. I know I’d feel more safe if you turn on the turn-by-turn voice option. I love the turn-by-turn voice option.
Ooh, sounds like that fellow knows what he’s talking about. I’d put on my listening ears if I were you.
I found a hack online. I was able to upload MP3 recordings of my voice to your GPS.
Shh, he said it’s interesting.
Oh, they shot a lot of Star Trek episodes out there.
Oh, smashing. Now, Leonard, do you know how to get there?
Yeah, well luckily, someone in the car does.
None of you will get it. It’s Eisenhower.
I know Mr. Data isn’t supposed to smile, but here it comes.
Mr. Data’s weapon is his mind. I’m wielding it.
Stealing is against the law!
Nope. The only thing left to do now is assign blame. (To Raj) Nice going.
What kind of person leaves his keys in the car?
You’re right. Nice going.
Maybe we’re better off. What if we were to get in a car with a crazy person?
Well, perhaps we should hold up a sign that assures passing motorists of our mental competence.
What, you think just because you’re wearing a captain’s uniform, you’re in charge?
All right.
Gentlemen, a little less bellyaching. We’re Starfleet officers and a member of the Borg Collective.

Leonard, all our lives we have dreamed of finding ourselves inside one of the fantasy worlds we love. And look at us. At this moment, we are, in fact, a Star Trek landing party stranded in an alien and unforgiving environment, relying only on our wits, our fortitude and our moxie. As long as we have those things, nothing can stop…
I hate this planet.
Hello. Hello. Uh, uh, uh, four glasses of water, please. Anything for you guys?
Scotty was on the original series, and we’re Next Generation. So, joke’s on you.
Actually, it’s three against one.

Yeah, well, we’re not. We’re an imaginary landing party who had real-life garbage thrown at us by real-life strangers who think we’re idiots. And to tell you the truth, I’m starting to feel like one. I want to go home now.
Well, I say that’s the last time we ever go outside.
There’s only one logical explanation. Somewhere in the desert we crossed into an alternate dimension where the women in our lives can finally appreciate great literature.
Captain, what are your orders?
Wait. They might be hostile.
Penny: Hi. Here are the make-up sponges you asked for.
Damn, you’ve got more makeup than I do. You’ve got better makeup than I do. Yeah, I’m borrowing this.
I feel like you guys just went to Comic-Con.
Is that better?
Well, then why are you going?
All right. Well, you guys have fun. I guess I’ll see you Sunday night.
Okay.
What was that for?
Oh, this is the best. You have booze with breakfast on a Tuesday, you got a problem. You do it on the weekend, you got brunch.
I know. The four of them work at a major university. They’re all super smart. How can they still be into something made for 12-year-olds?
Mmmm. Now I feel bad for picking on all those kids. Although, in my defence, if Danny Biffle didn’t want to eat a mouthful of dirt, he shouldn’t have shown up to school wearing a bow tie.
Uh-uh.
That is an amazing idea. Okay, how many of these have I had?
Hey, Stuart.
No, we were just wondering why the guys like this stuff so much, so we thought we’d give it a try.
Well then, what do you recommend?
As evidenced by your boyfriend and his fear of hamsters.
Ooh, Thor! He’s hot.
Hmm, okay, I’m done. How did you guys finish so fast?
Yeah, well, I have street smarts.
Mmm.
Stupid?
I don’t know how Leonard can get so caught up in this.
I know. A hammer so heavy that no one else can pick it up?
That makes even less sense, I mean…
Okay, hang on, what if Thor’s hand is on the hammer? I mean, if he’s touching it with his god magic, does that mean I could lift it?
Well, which is it?
Okay.
Wait, I thought we were reading.
Yes!
You said it’s a magic hammer.
If Harry Potter’s wand can make decisions, why can’t Thor’s hammer?
Oh, yeah? Then how does the sun come up every day?

Oh, great. Yes. And then you will see, I am not wrong, because if we were in outer space, then anyone could pick up the hammer because it would be floating around in a weightless environment. Yeah, that’s right, the slow reader used science. Suck on that.
Okay, hang on. If I go to a bar and pick up a guy, and he picks up a girl, and then we all leave together, did I pick up the girl?
Hey, are we talking about me or are we talking about Thor?
Amy: Sheldon doesn’t believe in brunch. He can’t stand being at a table where one person’s having an omelette and another person’s having a sandwich.
When did Howard learn to sew?
I don’t even understand why they go to these conventions.
It’s probably because they were bullied growing up. In a world where you can’t fight back, superheroes provide meaningful wish-fulfillment.
No.
Seriously?
Who cares? Just soak it in. Hello, boys.
All right, well, who’s the best superhero?
Ooh, I do love a bad boy.
Well, there was a lot of action.
And the story moved along at a brisk pace. It was, overall, what’s the word I’m looking for?
So stupid.
What a waste of time.
No, no, no, it doesn’t. Thor is a god. The hammer is his, only he can use it. It’s like Sheldon and his toothbrush. Or his thin, beckoning lips.
Yes.
Maybe we missed something.
Yeah.
Good idea. I’ll help you.
We are. We’re just, uh, giving you a head start.
It says right here on the hammer, whoever holds this hammer, if he be worthy, shall possess the power of Thor.
No! It can’t decide. It’s a hammer.
Yeah, but, it can’t make decisions.
Okay, if you’re going to start comparing wands and hammers, I can’t even take you seriously.
You can’t pick something up in outer space. In space, there is no up.
Hard to argue with those kind of street smarts.
Yeah?
No. Hulk picked up Thor, Thor picked up the hammer.
Did that ever happen?
Bernadette: He’s not exhausting at all.
It’s cute how excited they are. You should have seen Howard sewing his costume all week for the convention.
When he was a little boy, every couple months, he would have to let his mom’s pants out.
I don’t mind it. I think Howie’s just in touch with his inner child. Although when he comes to bed in his Batman pyjamas, sometimes it feels like I’m touching his inner child.
I’ve never even read a comic book. You guys?
I mean, it’s such an important part of their lives. Maybe we should try reading some.
The comic book store isn’t far from here.
Why are they staring?
We were looking for a recommendation about comic books.
What kind of comics do the guys like?
I don’t know, there were a lot of pictures, and one page only had the word brakkadoom!
So, what’d you guys think?
It’s crazy, they spend hours arguing about things that don’t even exist.
I don’t think it’s heavy. It’s some sort of magic, so only Thor can lift it.
No.
Let’s read it again.
You want some tea?
Hold on, who decides who’s worthy? Does the hammer decide?
Leonard and Sheldon have boxes of comics across the hall. Why don’t we go look at those?
Well, what if the Hulk picked up Thor while Thor is holding the hammer?
Then by the transitive property of picking things up, Hulk picked up the hammer.
Penny (receiving text): Oh. It’s Leonard. He says they’re on the road and headed for Bakersfield at warp speed. Maybe it’s the mimosa, but I’m gonna give the kid an LOL.
Howard: Has it really only been ten miles?
Look, Leonard, there’s a bridge. Drive off it.
We’ve got our costumes in the trunk. We could go there and have a little photo shoot.
So what’s our first pose going to be?
Sheldon, how is that a fight pose?
Oh, my God. Leonard, someone’s stealing your car!
Good idea. Why don’t you get started on that?
I wish my mom was here. We could all hang out in her shadow.
Okay, I just talked to my mom. She arranged for us to get a rental car.
Maybe Thor’s Hammer is a new colour of nail polish.
GPS (in Sheldon\u2019s voice): Leonard, bear left and continue on Interstate 210.
Raj: That is so cool.
You know, we’re not that far from Vazquez Rocks.
Great idea. I haven’t had a carbohydrate in two weeks. These cheekbones need to be in front of a camera before I eat a pretzel and they’re gone.
And we’re blending, and we’re blending, and we’re done.
I say we begin with a classic Star Trek fight scene.
Phasers on the Borg! Charlie’s Angels.

Now let’s do some sexy glamour shots. I’ll set the mood. (Rhythmically) Oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, Yeah, nice one, oontz, oontz. That’s right. Oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz, oontz…
Stop!
I’ll call 911. What, oh, no, my phone is in my other pants.
What is wrong with people? Why don’t they stop?
Wool pants in the desert. I feel like I’ve got poached testicles.
Insurance is gonna buy you a new car. It’s not gonna de-funk my junk.
And about three hundred dollars worth of makeup, so this thief could look like anyone right now.
It, it is. It’s not just comic books. They’ve got action figures, toys, a Tron-themed dance party.
Great. We can still make it to Comic-Con.
Don’t be like that. Come on, Howard, talk to him.
Fine, then I guess it’s two against two. How do we decide?
What? What about the mission? You said we were a real-life landing party.
Okay. Did we at least rent the car from Enterprise? Get it? Enterprise? Screw you. That’s funny.
Are they actually arguing about comic books?
If it’s an alternate dimension, sounds like a job for a landing party.
GPS: Continue on Interstate 210 for five miles. Here’s an interesting fact about interstates.
Interstates are numbered as follows. Even-numbered routes run east and west, odd-numbered routes run north and south. Three-digit route numbers indicate bypasses or spurs.
Recalculating. While we’re waiting, do you know which president signed the Intestate Highway System Act into law? The answer, coming up in 14 miles.
Fun fact, President Eisenhower signed the Federal Aid Highway Act from his hospital room.
Say, can you name the four state capitols that are not served by the interstate system?
Stuart: Oh, hey. Could you please stop staring? They’re just girls. It’s nothing you haven’t seen in movies or in drawings.
Oh, well, I recommend you don’t open a store and sell them.
Oh, okay. What do you think you might be into? Superhero, fantasy, graphic novels, manga… I swear I will turn a hose on you.
Um, a little bit of everything. Mostly superhero stuff.
Shh! You can’t ask a question like that in here. Are you trying to start a rumble?
Well, uh, let’s see. You’ve got your basic clean-cut good guys, Superman, Spider-Man, Captain America. Then you have your darker anti-heroes, your Batman, your Wolverine, Punisher.
If I were you, I’d go for Fables number one. The artwork is sophisticated, it’s intelligently written, and it doesn’t objectify or stereotype women.
Howard (dressed as a Borg): Come on, guys. Let’s do this.
Leonard (dressed as Captain Picard): Yeah, I’m sweating my bald cap off.
Waitress: Why don’t you ask Scotty to beam you up?
Policeman: Was there anything valuable in the car?
I don’t know, sounds pretty cool.
I think I have all I need here. You guys need me to call someone? I’m guessing your moms?
Amy (off): Look, right here. Red Hulk is picking up Thor’s hammer ’cause Thor’s touching it.
Penny (off): No, it’s because they’re in space. He’s really just touching the strap.
How could Red Hulk be worthy?
Amy(off): The strap is part of the hammer.
Bernadette (off): Then Red Hulk must be worthy.
Second Car Thief: You learn something new every day.
